It is characterized by its distinctive spiny stems and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. These plants are typically found in temperate regions of Asia, particularly in China and Japan. Ceratostema species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade. The genus includes several species, such as Ceratostema glabrum and Ceratostema thunbergii, which are popular in horticulture.
